greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of ways to place 2n points on a 2n X 2n square array of points such that no three points are collinear and the configuration has 90-degree rotational symmetry.
comment: No such arrangement is possible on a 2n+1 X 2n+1 grid.
link: D. B. Anderson, Sample solutions for n = 18, 20, 22, 24, 26
David Brent Anderson Update on the no-three-in-line problem, J. Combin. Theory Ser. A 27 (1979), no. 3, 365--366. MR0555806(81g:05055).
A. Flammenkamp, Solutions of the no-three-in-line problem
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, May 29 2012
ext: a(11)-a(21) from _Giovanni Resta_, Mar 22 2013 (data from A. Flammenkamp's website)
